title: Support CM14.1
body:
It does not work on CM14.1 (on a samsung galaxy S5).
Do you plan to support it in the near future?

title: Lock screen time out not being respected
body: I have my lock screen set to come on 10 minutes after the screen shuts off but when I close my lid with hall monitor and the sview disappears it locks right away forcing me to enter my pin when I open the lid. Also for whatever reason despite my trust location here at work the lock screen is still coming on while I'm here and close and open the lid. I use CM13 on my note 3. Love this tho. Just wish it used my whole sview. The notes have larger sview flip covers than the so.

title: Support for CM13
body: not yet: FLAG_TURN_SCREEN_ON needs to be implemented

title: avoid the SuperUser toast every time
label: [Label(name="bug"), Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
It's kind of annoying to see the toast from SuperUser every time the cover is opened. There are two ways I see to fix this low-priority annoyance:
1. [edit] Do nothing, and let the user go into SuperUser and turn off the toasts if they wish.
2. Instead of running a new "su" process every time, just keep the process open from when the service starts. Then we can send it echo commands as needed.
3. Write a little shell script or NDK program that we run when the service starts, and stays open to receive our commands and do the root actions.

3 seems a little more secure, since it still keeps a root-privileged process running, but it's much more restricted in what it will do than a full-fledged "su" shell. Right now, the only commands run are "whoami" and "echo clear_cover_mode..." so the program would be nearly as simple as "cat". But for answering phone calls we will need to run another process ("input") as well, to spoof keystrokes.

I was talking to some people on #android-root and they more or less suggested 3. I didn't even realize 1 was an option until it was pointed out below. It still might be cleaner to have a process/script centralizing the root actions in one place.

title: S4 Mini issues
body:
This could serve as a thread for issues that are specific for the S4 Mini for which an S-View Cover exists, as well. AFAIK, there are at least three different versions of this device (LTE/3G/Dual SIM). I have the LTE version which is officially known as the _GT-I9195_ and on Cyanogenmod as [_serranoltexx_](http://wiki.cyanogenmod.org/w/Serranoltexx_Info). I started with CM10.2, but now I am on the CM11 nightlies. It turns out that HallMonitor is really useful on the Mini, too. However, the on and off trigger seems to be firing less reliable than on the big S4. The apk in the master branch is mostly unfunctional, but @Wallace0 has refined the detection so that the hit rate is much better now. Currently I use the [apk in the merge branch](https://github.com/durka/HallMonitor/tree/merge/bin). To come up with some real numbers, I opened and closed the cover 20 times, with these results:
openclose

title: delay timer starts before lockscreen comes up
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
It takes a little bit of time for the lock screen to come up after calling `DevicePolicyManager.lockNow`. But Hall Monitor's timer doesn't know this. So when the lockscreen is already up and the cover is closed, it _seems_ to stay up longer than when the cover is closed on an unlocked phone. This makes it hard to set a good delay time.

Solutions include:
- two delay settings
- multiply the delay by 0.75 or something
- wait for the lockscreen to come up (somehow) before starting the countdown
- replace the lockscreen with our own thing that comes up instantly (i.e. #4)

title: Wake on phone call
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Depends on #4.

Ideally you'd get to answer/reject the call without opening the cover, but this might be difficult. At least you should get to see what's happening before you open the cover.

title: Put our own activity or widget on top of the lockscreen
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
The default lockscreen, with cLock, happens to have the clock visible through the view cover, and you can kind of see the notification bar, but nothing else. There's a bunch of wasted space above the clock.

S View has a whole different activity that is "on top" of the lockscreen, and is black except for under the view cover. It has a clock and some notifications (email, text) but it's not configurable.

I want to either make an activity like that, or make a lockscreen widget, or enhance cLock, to make better use of the space.

title: App ignores result of Device Admin request
label: [Label(name="bug")]
body:
It assumes the device admin request was granted and starts the service without checking. This could result in a crash if admin status was not, in fact, granted.

Since this is called from the Configuration activity, it should be possible to use `startActivityForResult` and use the response. Or, just wait for the `DEVICE_ADMIN_ENABLED` intent to start the service.
